metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13095 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in fs/xfs/libxfs/xfs_inode_buf.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.17.3. A denial of service (memory corruption and BUG) canoccur for a corrupted xfs image upon encountering an inode that is inextent format, but has more extents than fit in the inode fork.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13095` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1150-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1150.161
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1154-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1154.164
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1126-aws - 4.4.0-1126.140
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1112-azure - 4.15.0-1112.124~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1097-gcp - 4.15.0-1097.110~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1091-kvm - 4.4.0-1091.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1098-aws - 4.15.0-1098.105~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1069-oracle - 4.15.0-1069.77~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-207.239').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
